page.title: 07ELVASTON PARK AND FIELDS
page.content: The main public entrance and car park to {Elvaston Castle Country Park}is sited here.The woodland is bounded by {a hedge}which was dated as being{over {four hundred years old}by counting seven different species of trees and woody shrubs in a 100m.length.It contained oak,sycamore,Canadian balsam,beech,mountain ash,elderberry and lime.The area is{rich in wildlife. Land to the east of the{B5010 provides part of the grazing for a flock of 120 sheep and a herd of 30 {Friesian}and{Ayrshire}suckling cattle.In addition to the silage produced,barley is grown in one large and two smaller fields.A disused,brick outbuilding stands in this area.Hedges have grown untended and a few have been removed.Food and shelter for wildlife is provided by the hedges and a number of scattered,mature trees.
